intro: Draba aizoon var. athoa, commonly known as the alpine penny-cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–20 centimeters. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. It is native to alpine and arctic regions of Europe and Asia, thriving in rocky and gravelly soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in high-altitude environments where few plants can survive.
